articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Journalist covering coronavirus: U.S. lags behind in testing
articles.description: Coronavirus cases in the U.S. are steadily climbing, as American authorities test far fewer people than other countries per day, according to reports. Robinson Meyer, staff writer at The Atlantic, joins Joy Reid to discuss his reporting on what he describes a…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Grand Princess cruise ship to dock in Oakland
articles.description: The Grand Princess cruise ship carrying 21 people who have tested positive for coronavirus was cleared by state and federal officials to dock in Oakland, California, Princess Cruises said late Saturday.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gov. Cuomo confirms rise in number of coronavirus cases
articles.description: Nine states have issued emergency declarations due to the coronavirus. Dr. Anthony Fauci and New York Governor Andrew Cuomo comment on the rising number of cases.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gov. Cuomo on coronavirus: 'We're fighting the fear even more than the virus.'
articles.description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo discusses the state of COVID-19 in New York with Alex Witt. Cuomo says mixed messages from the Trump administration are creating fear among Americans regarding the virus.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Is Italy’s massive coronavirus quarantine sign of things to come?
articles.description: Coronavirus cases now number over 107,000 worldwide, as Italy quarantines millions in one of its regions in an attempt to contain the epidemic. NBC News Chief Foreign Correspondent Richard Engel joins Joy Reid with his reporting.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: High school junior describes life on cruise ship where 21 people test positive for coronavirus
articles.description: Kailee Higgins Ott, a high school junior, describes life aboard the Grand Princess, a cruise ship off the coast of California where 21 people have tested positive for coronavirus.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Woodrow Wilson lied about ‘Spanish Flu,’ likely helping it spread
articles.description: Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak in the U.S. is compared to President Woodrow Wilson’s response to the ‘Spanish Flu’ outbreak during WWI, during which Wilson lied to the public to prevent panic about the deadly, viral outbreak that killed 6…
